venue.name: Kendall Cinema (part of the Landmark chain)

item.description:
The Boston Phoenix describes Beginners as a "Woody Allenish romp." My last event for this meetup group was Woody Allen's movie Midnight in Paris, so let's go see if the Phoenix is right.

Beginners stars Ewan McGregor, Christopher Plummer, Melanie Laurent, Mary Page Keller, and a talking dog. So it already has one thing in common with Midnight in Paris: a bit of fantasy. McGregor plays Plummer's son, a guy who can't commit and somehow learns to find love. It sounds optimistic and uplifting, which is exactly why I would like to see it. I'm sure the ragtime, blues, and jazz soundtrack will be another plus.

The movie starts at 6:30 p.m. I will buy my ticket around 6 p.m. and then wait by the foot of the stairs in the theater lobby for about 15 minutes. Look for me and my bright red backpack. I'll head into the theater auditorium between 6:15 and 6:20. If you are late, look for me in the auditorium or back in the lobby after the movie.

After the movie and the credits, I'll wait for a bit in the theater lobby to gather everyone together. We can decide then if we would like to go to The Friendly Toast for tea and/or something to eat.

For more information about the theater, go to http://www.landmarktheaters.com/

For more information about The Friendly Toast, go to http://www.thefriendlytoast.net/

See you Wednesday at the Kendall!

Marianne
item.how_to_find_us: Look for me and my bright red backpack. See the event description for more details.
item.name: Beginners at the Kendall
